text: Zamora Cathedral is a Roman Catholic cathedral in Zamora, Spain.Caroline Trefler; Fodor's Travel Publications, Inc., Spain 2009 (New York: Fodor's, 2009), p. 198 It was built in the middle of the 12th century. King Alfonso VII of Le√≥n and Castile sponsored the construction. The cathedral was built mostly in the Romanesque architectural style. It also has Byzantine influences. It is built on the Latin cross floor plan. Its last bell was built in 1805. == References == == Other websites == * Photos * Monuments in Zamora, Spain: Catedral de Zamora Category:Roman Catholic cathedrals in Spain Category:12th- century buildings and structures Category:Province of Zamora
title: Zamora Cathedral
